## Early 20th century: methods

:::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}

  - 1935: *Design of Experiments*

## Branch Rickey era: methods

:::: {.columns} 
::: {.column width="50%"}
  - 1953: Metropolis's paper on [Monte Carlo methods](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nicholas_Metropolis#Monte_Carlo_method)
  - 1959: [Lehmann's *Testing Statistical Hypotheses*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_important_publications_in_statistics)
  - 1970: Codd's ["A Relational Model of Data for Large Shared Data Banks"](http://www.quickbase.com/articles/timeline-of-database-history)

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
  <img src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a6/3dRosenbrock.png/350px-3dRosenbrock.png" width="400px">

  - 1970: [Metropolis-Hastings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolis%E2%80%93Hastings_algorithm) for MCMC
  
:::
::::

## Summary

|         data      |  rows  |  tool  |  method  |  result  |
|:-----------------:|:-----:|:-----:|:------:|:----:|
|     boxscores     | dozens    |   paper   |  arithmetic   | rates  |
|     tabulated     | hundreds    |   adding machine   |  arithmetic   | formulas  |
|     compiled     | thousands    |   calculator   |  algebra   | metrics  |
|   seasonal   | 100 k    |   spreadsheet   |  regression   | metrics  |
|   play-by-play   | 1 M    |   SQL (laptop)   |  regression   | fitted models  |
|   pitch-by-pitch   | 10 M    |   SQL (server)   |  mixed, Bayesian   | statistical models  |
|   player tracking   | billions  |   Spark   |  ML   | ?  |
